availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Crittenden County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Rebecca A. Thurmond. Father of William J. Thurmond, James M. Thurmond, E. A. Thurmond, P. J. Thurmond, F. S. Thurmond, Israel Snead Thurmond, Mary J. Thurmond, Martin C. Thurmond, P. G. Thurmond, and P. H. Thurmond. Farmer in Crittenden County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned five enslaved persons in Crittenden County in 1850. Farmer in Crittenden County in 1860. Owned nine enslaved persons in Crittenden County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden County, District 2, p. 257B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden County, District 2, pp. 465-466.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden County, District 2, p. 359.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden County, District 2, p. 4.
